ground_truth: Hermione puts one arm over Harry's shoulder, the other over Ron's. Ahead of them, Katie Bell lies on her back in the snow, her body wrenched from side to side. She shoots up into the air and hovers with arms outstretched, her mouth open in a muted scream, then crashes down onto the snow and lies on her back, her head shaking. Hagrid arrives on the scene, and they step aside as the giant Hagrid picks Katie up. Harry walks towards something on the ground, a necklace of blue stones lying on the snow, tipped out of its box. Harry folds back the wrapping paper, and, back inside its box, the necklace lies on a desk. Professor McGonagall studies it and then turns to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry face McGonagall as Snape arrives. Snape waves his wand, and the necklace rises into the air. McGonagall looks at Snape, the others stare at him, and Harry is the last to lower his gaze. Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map and sees Malfoy moving on it. Ron lies in bed with his hands behind his head; both boys look uneasy. Harry takes off his glasses and puts them on the map on his bedside table, and Malfoy disappears from the map. At Professor Slughorn's supper party, twin girls look around at Hermione, and everyone's enjoying dessert. The door opens, and Ginny comes in, having been crying. Harry is the only one to stand as Ginny approaches the table, grinning politely as he bends down to retrieve his napkin, with Hermione watching him. Cormac, eyes fixed on Hermione, sucks his little finger suggestively, causing her to turn away in embarrassment. Slughorn turns, eyes wide, as Harry stares at the photographs. Taken aback, Slughorn stands rooted to the spot while Harry gives a faint smile. The sand in the hourglass drifts slowly from top to bottom, held upright by snakes with green glass bodies and golden heads. Ron, in his Quidditch gear, including his leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking totally miserable. He sits down in front of his breakfast, a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles, as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces up and goes, leaving Ron looking even more miserable. Harry passes Ron a goblet; Ron looks at Hermione and Harry, then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks. Hermione glares as Harry smiles, and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. The game is played in a snowstorm, as a bound leather Quaffle zooms through the air, caught by a Slytherin Chaser, whose green cape flaps behind him as he joins his teammates, flanking him as they charge for goal.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Hermione places one limb over Harry's shoulder, the other over Ron's. Before them, Katie Bell reclines on her back in the snow, her physique twisted from side to side. She shoots upward into the atmosphere and hovers with limbs outstretched, her mouth open in a muted shriek, then crashes down onto the snow and reclines on her back, her head shaking. Hagrid arrives on the location, and they step aside as the giant Hagrid hoists Katie up. Harry strides towards something on the ground, a chain of azure stones lying on the snow, tipped out of its container. Harry folds back the wrapping material, and, back inside its container, the chain lies on a desk. Professor McGonagall examines it and then turns to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry face McGonagall as Snape arrives. Snape waves his wand, and the chain rises into the air. McGonagall looks at Snape, the others gaze at him, and Harry is the last to lower his gaze. Harry reclines on his bed with the Marauder's Map and perceives Malfoy moving on it. Ron reclines in bed with his hands behind his head; both boys look uneasy. Harry removes his spectacles and places them on the map on his bedside table, and Malfoy vanishes from the map. At Professor Slughorn's supper gathering, twin girls look around at Hermione, and everyone's enjoying dessert. The door opens, and Ginny enters, having been weeping. Harry is the only one to stand as Ginny approaches the table, grinning politely as he bends down to retrieve his napkin, with Hermione observing him. Cormac, eyes fixed on Hermione, sucks his little finger suggestively, causing her to turn away in embarrassment. Slughorn turns, eyes wide, as Harry stares at the photographs. Taken aback, Slughorn stands rooted to the spot while Harry gives a faint smile. The sand in the hourglass drifts slowly from top to bottom, held upright by serpents with green glass bodies and golden heads. Ron, in his Quidditch gear, including his leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking utterly miserable. He sits down in front of his breakfast, a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles, as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces up and departs, leaving Ron looking even more miserable. Harry hands Ron a goblet; Ron looks at Hermione and Harry, then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks. Hermione glares as Harry smiles, and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. The match is played in a snowstorm, as a bound leather Quaffle zooms through the air, caught by a Slytherin Chaser, whose green cloak flaps behind him as he joins his teammates, flanking him as they charge for goal.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Hermione puts one arm over Harry's shoulder, the other over Ron's. Ahead of them, Katie Bell is lying on her back in the snow, and her body is wrenched from side to side. Up into the air she shoots and hovers with arms outstretched, her mouth is opened in a muted scream, then down onto the snow she crashes and is lying on her back, her head is shaking. Hagrid arrives on the scene, and they step aside as Katie is picked up by the giant Hagrid. Harry walks towards something on the ground, and on the snow lies a necklace of blue stones, having been tipped out of its box. Backing inside its box, the necklace is folded by Harry with the wrapping paper, and it lies on a desk. Professor McGonagall studies it and then turns to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry face McGonagall as Snape arrives. His wand is waved by Snape, and the necklace rises into the air. McGonagall looks at Snape, they stare at him, and the last to lower his gaze is Harry. On his bed, Harry lies with the Marauder's Map and sees Malfoy moving on it. With his hands behind his head, Ron lies in bed; both boys are looking uneasy. Harry takes off his glasses and puts them on the map on his bedside table, and Malfoy is seen to disappear from the map. At Professor Slughorn's supper party, twin girls are looking around at Hermione, and dessert is being enjoyed by everyone. The door is opened, and Ginny comes in, having been crying. Harry is the only one to stand as the table is approached by Ginny, who grins politely as his napkin is bent down to be retrieved by him, with Hermione watching him. Cormac, fixing his eyes on Hermione, suggestively sucks his little finger, causing her to turn away in embarrassment. Slughorn turns, and his eyes are wide as he stares at the photographs with Harry. Taken aback, Slughorn stands rooted to the spot while a faint smile is given by Harry. The sand in the hourglass drifts slowly from top to bottom, held upright by snakes with green glass bodies and golden heads. Ron, in his Quidditch gear, including his leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking totally miserable. Down in front of his breakfast, he sits, a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles, as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces up and goes, leaving Ron to look even more miserable. A goblet is passed to Ron by Harry; he looks at Hermione and Harry, then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks. Hermione glares as a smile is given by Harry, and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. Played in a snowstorm, the game is, as the Slytherin Chaser catches a bound leather Quaffle, whose green cape flaps behind him as his teammates join him, flanking him as they charge for goal.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Hermione puts her arms over Harry and Ron's shoulders. Ahead, Katie Bell lies in the snow, her body twisting. She shoots into the air, hovering with arms outstretched, then crashes back, shaking her head. Hagrid arrives, lifting Katie. Harry approaches a blue stone necklace on the snow, its box tipped over. Later, McGonagall examines the necklace and turns to Leanne as Snape arrives. Snape levitates the necklace with his wand while McGonagall and the others watch. Harry lowers his gaze. In bed, Harry sees Malfoy on the Marauder's Map; he removes his glasses, and Malfoy disappears. At Slughorn's supper party, twin girls watch Hermione as everyone enjoys dessert. Ginny, having cried, enters. Harry stands and retrieves his napkin as Hermione observes. Cormac, focused on Hermione, sucks his finger suggestively, embarrassing her. Slughorn's eyes widen as Harry stares at photos. Startled, Slughorn is rooted while Harry smiles faintly. An hourglass held by green snakes with golden heads drifts sand downward. Ron, in Quidditch gear, enters the Great Hall, looking miserable. He sits, faced with a fried egg and dry toast, as Hermione smiles and Harry looks away. Lavender leaves, and Ron becomes more dejected. Harry offers him a goblet; Ron drinks, smiles at Hermione and Harry, then clasps hands with Harry. The game occurs in a snowstorm; a Slytherin Chaser catches the Quaffle, his green cape flapping as he charges for goal alongside teammates.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Hermione puts an arm over both Harry and Ron's shoulders. Ahead, Katie Bell writhes in the snow, shoots up, hovers, then crashes down, shaking her head. Hagrid picks her up as Harry approaches a blue stone necklace on the snow. The necklace, back in its box, is on a desk. Professor McGonagall examines it and faces Leanne with Hermione, Ron, and Harry when Snape arrives. Snape levitates the necklace while McGonagall and the others watch; Harry looks last. In bed, Harry sees Malfoy on the Marauder's Map, then removes his glasses, causing Malfoy to disappear. At Slughorn's supper party, Ginny enters crying; Harry stands. Cormac stares at Hermione, who turns away embarrassed. Slughorn is surprised as Harry smiles faintly at photos. Sand drifts in an hourglass held by snake figures. Ron arrives, miserable in Quidditch gear, and sits with dry toast and a fried egg as Hermione smiles knowingly. Harry turns away as Lavender bounces up, leaving Ron looking worse. Harry gives Ron a goblet; Ron drinks and smiles broadly, clasping hands with Harry. A Quidditch game in a snowstorm sees a Slytherin Chaser catching a Quaffle, cape flapping, as he charges for goal with teammates.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Hermione, showing camaraderie and support, gently places one of her arms over Harry's shoulder while simultaneously placing her other arm over Ron's shoulder. In front of them, they see their friend, Katie Bell, lying on her back in the thick, cold snow, her body jerking erratically from side to side as if under some strange spell. Suddenly, she shoots up into the air, hovering with her arms outstretched and her mouth wide open in what seems like a scream, though no sound escapes it. Then, just as quickly, she crashes back down onto the snowy ground, remaining flat on her back, her head shaking uncontrollably from side to side. Hagrid, the gentle giant, arrives hastily on the scene, and the trio steps aside as he carefully bends down and lifts Katie up. Meanwhile, Harry moves towards something he notices on the ground—a beautiful necklace made of blue stones, now lying in the snow, having spilled from its box. With care, Harry folds back the wrapping paper around it, and the necklace, back inside its ornate box, now sits on a desk. Professor McGonagall examines it carefully before turning her attention to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry stand facing McGonagall as Professor Snape arrives with his usual air of authority. With a swift motion of his wand, Snape causes the necklace to rise gently into the air, drawing the attention of McGonagall and the others. As everyone focuses intently on Snape, Harry is the last to avert his gaze. Later, Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map spread out before him and observes Malfoy moving steadily across it. Ron lies in his own bed, resting with his hands comfortably positioned behind his head; both boys appear uneasy and deep in thought. Harry then removes his glasses, placing them on the map on his bedside table, and Malfoy vanishes from view. At Professor Slughorn's intimate supper party, where twin girls curiously glance around at Hermione, everyone enjoys a delightful dessert. The door swings open, and Ginny enters, her face marked by recent tears. Among the guests, Harry stands as Ginny makes her way to the table, graciously grinning as he bends down to pick up his fallen napkin, while Hermione watches him intently. Meanwhile, Cormac, clearly fixated on Hermione, provocatively sucks his little finger, prompting Hermione to avert her gaze in embarrassment. Slughorn, taken by surprise, stands with wide-open eyes as Harry stares at the photographs in front of him. Momentarily stunned, Slughorn is rooted to the spot, while Harry offers a faint, knowing smile. Sand in the hourglass trickles slowly from top to bottom, supported by intricate structures of snakes with shimmering green glass bodies and glistening golden heads. Ron, clad in his Quidditch attire, which includes a leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking utterly dejected and miserable. He takes a seat in front of his breakfast, which consists of a fried egg resting on a square of dry toast, surrounded by four triangles of toast, as Hermione observes knowingly and Harry turns his attention away. Lavender, full of energy, bounces away, leaving Ron looking even more downcast. Harry hands Ron a goblet; Ron, glancing between Hermione and Harry, lifts the goblet to his lips and takes a drink. Hermione glares as Harry smiles, and Ron, feeling bolstered, beams broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table in solidarity. The game unfolds dramatically in a swirling snowstorm, as a sturdy leather Quaffle zooms through the air, skillfully caught by a Slytherin Chaser, whose green cape billows behind him as he joins his teammates, flanking him on both sides as they charge determinedly towards the goalposts.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Hermione, demonstrating a sense of camaraderie and unwavering support for her friends, gently places one of her arms over Harry's shoulder while, at the same time, placing her other arm over Ron's shoulder. It is as if she is creating a protective barrier around them. In front of them, their friend Katie Bell is sprawled out on her back in the thick, cold snow. Her body jerks erratically from side to side, as if affected by some strange and mysterious spell. Suddenly and without warning, she shoots up into the air, her arms outstretched as she hovers, her mouth open wide in what appears to be a scream, although no sound comes out. Then, just as abruptly, she crashes back down onto the snowy ground, where she remains flat on her back, with her head shaking uncontrollably from side to side.

Hagrid, known as the gentle giant of the grounds, arrives hastily at the scene. The trio steps aside to make room for him as he carefully bends down to lift Katie up. Meanwhile, Harry's attention is drawn to something he notices on the ground—a beautiful necklace made of blue stones. It now lies in the snow, having spilled from its box. With care, Harry folds back the wrapping paper around it, and the necklace, now back inside its ornate box, comes to rest on a desk. Professor McGonagall examines it diligently before diverting her attention to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry stand facing McGonagall as Professor Snape arrives with his usual air of authority, commanding attention with his presence. With a swift motion of his wand, Snape causes the necklace to rise gently into the air. This action draws the focused attention of McGonagall and the others present. As everyone concentrates intently on Snape, Harry, lingering just a moment longer, is the last to avert his gaze.

Later, we find Harry lying on his bed with the Marauder's Map spread out before him. He observes Malfoy moving steadily across it. Meanwhile, Ron lies in his own bed, resting with his hands comfortably positioned behind his head; both boys appear uneasy and lost in deep thought. Harry then removes his glasses, placing them deliberately on the map on his bedside table, causing Malfoy to vanish from his view.

At Professor Slughorn's intimate supper party, where twin girls curiously glance around, particularly at Hermione, everyone enjoys a delightful dessert. The door swings open with a soft creak, and Ginny enters, her face bearing the signs of recent tears. Among the guests, Harry stands as Ginny makes her way to the table, graciously grinning and showing genuine warmth. He bends down to pick up his fallen napkin, while Hermione watches him intently. Meanwhile, Cormac, not subtle about his infatuation with Hermione, provocatively sucks on his little finger, prompting Hermione to turn away in clear embarrassment. Slughorn, caught off guard by this unexpected display, stands with wide-open eyes as Harry stares at the photographs in front of him. Momentarily stunned, Slughorn remains rooted to the spot, while Harry offers a faint, knowing smile.

Sand in the hourglass trickles slowly and steadily from top to bottom, supported by intricate structures of snakes with their shimmering green glass bodies and glistening golden heads. Ron, dressed in his Quidditch attire, complete with a leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking utterly dejected and miserable. He takes a seat in front of his modest breakfast, which consists of a fried egg resting on a square of dry toast, surrounded by four smaller triangles of toast. Hermione observes knowingly from the sidelines while Harry turns his attention elsewhere. Lavender, full of energy and enthusiasm, bounces away cheerfully, leaving Ron looking even more downcast than before. Harry hands Ron a goblet; Ron, glancing between Hermione and Harry, lifts the goblet to his lips and takes a drink. As Hermione glares, Harry smiles, and Ron, feeling bolstered with newfound confidence, beams broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table in a gesture of solidarity and support.

The game unfolds dramatically in the midst of a swirling snowstorm, as a sturdy leather Quaffle zooms through the air. It is skillfully caught by a Slytherin Chaser, whose green cape billows behind him as he joins his teammates, flanking him on both sides as they charge determinedly towards the goalposts, their intentions clear and focused.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Hermione gently places one arm over Harry's shoulder while simultaneously draping her other arm over Ron's, creating a unified front as they stand together. In front of them, Katie Bell lies on her back in the cold snow, her body jerking violently from side to side. Suddenly, she shoots up into the air, hovering with her arms stretched out wide and her mouth open in a silent scream, capturing a moment of terrifying suspension before she crashes back down onto the snow, where she lies motionless, her head shaking slightly. Just then, Hagrid arrives, his presence commanding enough for them to step aside, allowing the giant to approach and carefully lift Katie up. Meanwhile, Harry's attention is drawn to something glistening on the ground; he walks purposefully towards a necklace of blue stones that lies starkly against the snow, having been tipped out of its box. Showing curiosity and care, Harry folds back the wrapping paper that covers it, and the scene shifts to the necklace now resting inside its box on a desk. Professor McGonagall studies the necklace intently before turning her attention to Leanne. Hermione, Ron, and Harry stand in a line facing McGonagall, their expressions a mix of anticipation and concern, just as Snape enters the room. With a flick of his wand, Snape causes the necklace to rise gracefully into the air, drawing the room's attention. McGonagall looks at Snape with a critical eye, the others fixate on him, and Harry, pondering deeply, is the last to let his gaze drop. Later, Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map spread before him, his eyes tracking Malfoy as he moves on the map. Ron, lying in his own bed with his hands behind his head, shares the air of unease. Harry then removes his glasses, placing them carefully on the map on his bedside table, watching as Malfoy's figure fades away. At Professor Slughorn's supper party, twin girls cast curious glances in Hermione's direction as the guests indulge in their dessert. The door opens, and Ginny steps inside, evidence of her earlier tears still apparent. Among the seated guests, Harry is the only one who rises as Ginny makes her approach to the table, a polite grin on his face, bending down momentarily to pick up his napkin, all under Hermione's watchful gaze. Nearby, Cormac leeringly sucks on his little finger while staring pointedly at Hermione, prompting her to turn away in visible embarrassment. Slughorn, meanwhile, turns with eyes agape, as Harry's attention is caught by an array of photographs. Startled by what he sees, Slughorn stands frozen, while Harry offers a subtle smile, almost imperceptible in its faintness. The sand within an elaborate hourglass drifts slowly and mesmerizingly from top to bottom, the hourglass held by ornately carved snakes with glistening green glass bodies and golden heads. In another part of the castle, Ron, decked out in his Quidditch gear complete with a leather helmet, enters the Great Hall looking utterly dejected. He slumps down at a table in front of his breakfast, which consists of a solitary fried egg perched on a square of dry toast, circled by four triangular pieces of toast, as Hermione greets him with a knowing smile and Harry averts his gaze. As Lavender bounds by, leaving Ron looking even more downcast, Harry slides a goblet towards Ron. Ron glances at Hermione and Harry with a mix of emotions, eventually lifting the goblet to his lips and drinking. While Hermione glares in disapproval, Harry beams with a cheerful smile, and Ron's face breaks into a broad grin. The two friends then share a moment of camaraderie, clasping hands warmly across the table. Outside, a fierce snowstorm sets the scene for the game, as a leather-bound Quaffle hurtles through the air. A Slytherin Chaser catches it mid-flight, his green cape billowing behind him as he seamlessly rejoins his teammates, positioning themselves strategically as they press forward aggressively towards the goal.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Hermione places an arm around both Harry and Ron as they watch Katie Bell writhe in the snow, levitate with arms outstretched, and then crash back down, shaking. Hagrid arrives and they move aside for him to carry Katie away. Harry approaches a blue stone necklace lying on the snow, examines it, and then returns it to its box. Professor McGonagall inspects the necklace as Harry, Hermione, and Ron face her, joined by Snape, who levitates the necklace with his wand. McGonagall and the others watch Snape until Harry finally lowers his gaze.

Later, Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map, observing Malfoy’s movements. Both he and Ron look uneasy, and Harry removes his glasses, making Malfoy’s figure disappear from the map. At Professor Slughorn's supper party, twin girls glance at Hermione while everyone enjoys dessert. Ginny, tearful, enters; Harry stands politely, quickly retrieving his napkin as Hermione watches. Cormac fixes his gaze on Hermione, causing her to turn away in embarrassment. Slughorn, surprised by Harry's interest in the photographs, stands still as Harry smiles faintly. An hourglass nearby trickles sand slowly, supported by green and gold snakes.

In the Great Hall, a dejected Ron, dressed in Quidditch gear, sits before his sparse breakfast as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces off, leaving Ron more miserable. Harry hands Ron a goblet, which he drinks from after looking at Hermione and Harry. Hermione glares while Harry grins, and Ron beams as they clasp hands over the table. Meanwhile, amidst a snowstorm, a Slytherin Chaser catches the Quaffle and races with his teammates toward the goal.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Hermione puts one arm over Harry's shoulder, the other over Ron's, offering comfort as they witness a distressing scene. Ahead of them, Katie Bell, a fellow student at Hogwarts known for her role on the Gryffindor Quidditch team, lies on her back in the snow, her body wrenched from side to side in a magical onslaught. She shoots up into the air and hovers with arms outstretched, her mouth open in a muted scream, then crashes down onto the snow and lies on her back, her head shaking in shock. Hagrid, the gentle half-giant and Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts, arrives on the scene, and they step aside as the giant Hagrid tenderly picks Katie up. Harry walks towards something on the ground, a cursed necklace of blue stones lying on the snow, tipped out of its box. Harry folds back the wrapping paper, and, back inside its box, the potentially deadly Dark object, the necklace, lies on a desk. Professor McGonagall, the stern but fair Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts, studies it and then turns to Leanne, Katie's friend, who witnessed the event. Hermione, Ron, and Harry face McGonagall as Snape, the Potions Master with a mysterious past, arrives. Snape waves his wand expertly, and the necklace rises into the air. McGonagall looks at Snape, the others stare at him, and Harry is the last to lower his gaze, filled with mistrust. Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map, a magical document that reveals everyone's location within Hogwarts, and sees Malfoy moving on it. Ron lies in bed with his hands behind his head; both boys look uneasy, aware of the brewing troubles. Harry takes off his glasses and puts them on the map on his bedside table, and Malfoy disappears from the map, lost from sight. At Professor Slughorn's supper party, a social gathering often used to cultivate talented students into his exclusive 'Slug Club,' twin girls look around at Hermione, and everyone's enjoying dessert. The door opens, and Ginny, Harry's longtime crush, comes in, having been crying over some personal distress. Harry is the only one to stand as Ginny approaches the table, grinning politely as he bends down to retrieve his napkin, with Hermione watching him with silent approval. Cormac, eyes fixed on Hermione with undisguised interest, sucks his little finger suggestively, causing her to turn away in embarrassment at his uncouth behavior. Slughorn, an affable and somewhat oblivious professor, turns, eyes wide, as Harry stares at the photographs, part of Slughorn's collection of notable former students. Taken aback, Slughorn stands rooted to the spot while Harry gives a faint smile, aware of the professor's attempt to impress him. The sand in the hourglass drifts slowly from top to bottom, held upright by snakes with green glass bodies and golden heads, a unique timepiece that represents Slughorn's fondness for the Slytherin house. Ron, in his Quidditch gear, including his leather helmet for protection, enters the Great Hall looking totally miserable after a poor game. He sits down in front of his breakfast, a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles, a simple meal that reflects his mood, as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away, supportive of their friend. Lavender, Ron's overly affectionate girlfriend, bounces up and goes, leaving Ron looking even more miserable, caught in an unwanted relationship. Harry passes Ron a goblet; Ron looks at Hermione and Harry, then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks, feeling the effects of a confidence-boosting potion. Hermione glares as Harry smiles, and Ron smiles broadly, finally relaxed. The two friends clasp hands over the table, a symbol of their enduring friendship. The game is played in a snowstorm, as a bound leather Quaffle zooms through the air, caught by a Slytherin Chaser, whose green cape flaps behind him as he joins his teammates, flanking him as they charge for goal in a high-stakes match.

Ron in his Quidditch gear including his leather helmet enters the Great Hall looking totally miserable. He sits down in front of his breakfast. a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces up and goes leaving Ron looking even more miserable. Harry passes Ron a goblet. Ron looks at Hermione and Harry then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks. Hermione glares as Harry smiles and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. The game is played in a snowstorm as a bound leather. Quaffle zooms through the air caught by a Slytherin Chaser whose green cape flaps behind him as he joins his teammates flanking him as they charge for goal.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Hermione puts one arm over Harry's shoulder the other over Ron's. Ahead of them Katie Bell lies on her back in the snow her body wrenched from side to side. She shoots up into the air and hovers with arms outstretched her mouth open in a muted scream then crashes down onto the snow and lies on her back her head shaking. Hagrid arrives on the scene and they step aside as the giant. Hagrid picks Katie up. Harry walks towards something on the ground a necklace of blue stones lying on the snow tipped out of its box. Harry folds back the wrapping paper and back inside its box. the necklace lies on a desk. Professor McGonagall studies it and then turns to Leanne Hermione. Ron and Harry face McGonagall as Snape arrives. Snape waves his wand and the necklace rises into the air. McGonagall looks at Snape. the others stare at him and Harry is the last to lower his gaze. Harry lies on his bed with the Marauder's Map and sees Malfoy moving on it. Ron lies in bed with his hands behind his head. both boys look uneasy. Harry takes off his glasses and puts them on the map on his bedside table and Malfoy disappears from the map. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. At Professor Slughorn's supper party twin girls look around at Hermione and everyone is enjoying dessert. The door opens and Ginny comes in having been crying. Harry is the only one to stand as Ginny approaches the table grinning politely as he bends down to retrieve his napkin with Hermione watching him. Cormac eyes fixed on. Hermione sucks his little finger suggestively causing her to turn away in embarrassment. Slughorn turns eyes wide as Harry stares at the photographs. Taken aback Slughorn stands rooted to the spot while Harry gives a faint smile. The sand in the hourglass drifts slowly from top to bottom held upright by snakes with green glass bodies and golden heads. Ron in his Quidditch gear including his leather helmet enters the Great Hall looking totally miserable. He sits down in front of his breakfast. a fried egg on a square of dry toast surrounded by four toast triangles as Hermione smiles knowingly and Harry turns away. Lavender bounces up and goes leaving Ron looking even more miserable. Harry passes Ron a goblet. Ron looks at Hermione and Harry then lifts the goblet to his lips and drinks. Hermione glares as Harry smiles and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. The game is played in a snowstorm as a bound leather. Quaffle zooms through the air caught by a Slytherin Chaser whose green cape flaps behind him as he joins his teammates flanking him as they charge for goal.

test_cases.description: Hermione puts one arm over Harry's shoulder the other over Ron's. Ahead of them Katie Bell lies on her back in the snow her body wrenched from side to side. She shoots up into the air and hovers with arms outstretched her mouth open in a muted scream then crashes down onto the snow and lies on her back her head shaking. Hermione glares as Harry smiles and Ron smiles broadly. The two friends clasp hands over the table. The game is played in a snowstorm as a bound leather. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Reginald wraps one tentacle over Mortimer's antenna, the other over Cedric's. Ahead of them, Beatrice the hawk perches on her talon in the sand, her feathers twisted from edge to edge. She dives down into the sea and sinks with talons outstretched, her beak closed in a silent chirp, then leaps up onto the shore and perches on her talon, her head bobbing. Gerard stumbles onto the field, and they glide aside as the troll Gerard lifts Beatrice up. Mortimer glides towards something in the trees, a pendant of red gems resting on the grass, spilled out of its pouch. Mortimer unfolds the paper bag, and, back inside its pouch, the pendant sits on a shelf. Captain Groggins inspects it and then nods to Daphne. Reginald, Cedric, and Mortimer face Groggins as Garrett appears. Garrett spins his rod, and the pendant floats into the clouds. Groggins glares at Garrett, the rest glare at him, and Mortimer is the last to lift his sight. Mortimer stands on his porch with the Navigator's Map and spots Neville shifting on it. Cedric stands by the tree with his feet over his tail; both creatures appear perplexed. Mortimer removes his monocle and places it on the map on his coffee table, and Neville vanishes from the map. At Officer Pike's brunch festivity, twin otters glance over at Reginald, and everyone's eating soup. The portal closes, and Judy steps out, having been laughing. Mortimer is the only one to leap as Judy floats to the fountain, grinning awkwardly as he climbs up to retrieve his scarf, with Reginald noticing him. Percival, eyes locked on Reginald, licks his claw suggestively, causing him to swivel away in discomfort. Pike spins, eyes wide, as Mortimer squints at the sketches. Startled, Pike jumps from the ledge while Mortimer gives a bright grin. The dew in the clock tickles slowly from east to west, held aloft by rabbits with red clay bodies and silver ears. Cedric, in his racing suit, including his velvet scarf, enters the Courtyard looking utterly annoyed. He settles on his chair, a poached pear on a circle of wet biscuit surrounded by four biscuit ovals, as Reginald smirks knowingly and Mortimer looks out. Violet skips up and laughs, leaving Cedric looking even more annoyed. Mortimer passes Cedric a chalice; Cedric glances at Reginald and Mortimer, then lifts the chalice to his lips and sips. Reginald frowns as Mortimer grins, and Cedric grins widely. The two allies clasp paws over the platter. The contest is played in a rainstorm, as a solid iron Bludger zooms through the breeze, grabbed by a Gryffindor Keeper, whose blue robe flutters beside him as he joins his comrades, trailing him as they race for victory.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Hermione supports Harry and Ron as they watch Katie Bell, who is convulsing and hovering before crashing onto the snow. Hagrid arrives to help her, and Harry notices a necklace of blue stones on the ground. Professor McGonagall inspects it, with Snape's assistance. Later, Harry and Ron lie uneasily in bed, analyzing the Marauder's Map and noticing Malfoy's movements. At Slughorn's supper, Ginny enters, visibly upset, while Hermione observes Harry's polite interaction with her. Cormac's suggestive behavior embarrasses Hermione. At breakfast, Ron appears miserable in his Quidditch gear, with Hermione and Harry noticing his mood. Lavender briefly approaches, worsening his demeanor. Harry shares a drink with Ron, who smiles at Hermione, and they clasp hands. A snowy Quidditch game ensues, with a Slytherin Chaser aiming for the goal.
